H0.text: Only younger frogs will survive is the most likely effect of a drought on a population of frogs that live in a shallow swamp.

H1.text: The number of predators will increase is the most likely effect of a drought on a population of frogs that live in a shallow swamp.

H2.text: Decrease in frog population as water evaporates is the most likely effect of a drought on a population of frogs that live in a shallow swamp.

H3.text: An increase in frog population as more land is exposed is the most likely effect of a drought on a population of frogs that live in a shallow swamp.

A4.text: lower flow-levels (with a decrease below the minimum leading to direct danger for amphibian life)
